questions.question: Farmer Ben has chickens and cows on his farm. He counts 15 heads and 40 legs altogether. How many chickens does he have?
questions.explanation:
Make a guess-and-check table:
• Guess 1: 8 chickens, 7 cows → Legs = 8×2 + 7×4 = 16 + 28 = 44 (too many legs)
• Guess 2: 10 chickens, 5 cows → Legs = 10×2 + 5×4 = 20 + 20 = 40 ✓
Answer: 10 chickens

questions.question: In a pond, there are ducks and turtles. There are 12 animals altogether with 34 legs. How many turtles are there?
questions.explanation:
Make a guess-and-check table:
• Guess 1: 6 ducks, 6 turtles → Legs = 6×2 + 6×4 = 12 + 24 = 36 (too many)
• Guess 2: 7 ducks, 5 turtles → Legs = 7×2 + 5×4 = 14 + 20 = 34 ✓
Answer: 5 turtles

questions.question: Mia has 20 coins in her piggy bank. Some are 50¢ coins and some are 20¢ coins. The total value is $7.00. How many 50¢ coins does she have?
questions.explanation:
Make a guess-and-check table (work in cents):
• Guess 1: 8 fifty-cent, 12 twenty-cent → Value = 8×50 + 12×20 = 400 + 240 = 640¢ (too low)
• Guess 2: 10 fifty-cent, 10 twenty-cent → Value = 10×50 + 10×20 = 500 + 200 = 700¢ ✓
Answer: 10 fifty-cent coins

questions.question: A parking lot has cars and motorcycles. There are 18 vehicles with 58 wheels altogether. How many cars are there?
questions.explanation:
Make a guess-and-check table:
• Guess 1: 10 cars, 8 motorcycles → Wheels = 10×4 + 8×2 = 40 + 16 = 56 (too few)
• Guess 2: 11 cars, 7 motorcycles → Wheels = 11×4 + 7×2 = 44 + 14 = 58 ✓
Answer: 11 cars

questions.question: In a quiz game, you get 4 points for each correct answer and lose 1 point for each wrong answer. You answered 20 questions and scored 65 points. How many questions did you answer correctly?
questions.explanation:
Make a guess-and-check table:
• Guess 1: 16 correct, 4 wrong → Score = 16×4 – 4×1 = 64 – 4 = 60 (too low)
• Guess 2: 17 correct, 3 wrong → Score = 17×4 – 3×1 = 68 – 3 = 65 ✓
Answer: 17 correct answers

questions.question: Bingo collected 25 seashells and starfish at the beach. Seashells have 0 legs, starfish have 5 legs. Altogether they have 65 legs. How many starfish did she collect?
questions.explanation:
Make a guess-and-check table:
• Since seashells have 0 legs, all legs come from starfish.
• Guess: 13 starfish → Legs = 13×5 = 65 ✓
• Check total items: 13 starfish + 12 seashells = 25 items ✓
Answer: 13 starfish

questions.question: Bandit has $2 and $5 notes in his wallet. He has 14 notes altogether worth $52. How many $5 notes does he have?
questions.explanation:
Make a guess-and-check table:
• Guess 1: 7 five-dollar, 7 two-dollar → Value = 7×$5 + 7×$2 = $35 + $14 = $49 (too low)
• Guess 2: 8 five-dollar, 6 two-dollar → Value = 8×$5 + 6×$2 = $40 + $12 = $52 ✓
Answer: 8 five-dollar notes

questions.question: At a pet shop, there are birds and puppies. There are 18 animals with 56 legs altogether. How many birds are there?
questions.explanation:
Make a guess-and-check table:
• Guess 1: 10 birds, 8 puppies → Legs = 10×2 + 8×4 = 20 + 32 = 52 (too few)
• Guess 2: 8 birds, 10 puppies → Legs = 8×2 + 10×4 = 16 + 40 = 56 ✓
Answer: 8 birds

questions.question: Winton has 30 coins. Some are 10¢ coins and some are 50¢ coins. The total value is $9.00. How many 10¢ coins does he have?
questions.explanation:
Make a guess-and-check table (work in cents):
• Guess 1: 12 ten-cent, 18 fifty-cent → Value = 12×10 + 18×50 = 120 + 900 = 1020¢ (too high)
• Guess 2: 15 ten-cent, 15 fifty-cent → Value = 15×10 + 15×50 = 150 + 750 = 900¢ ✓
Answer: 15 ten-cent coins

questions.question: A farmer has goats and chickens. There are 22 animals with 68 legs altogether. How many goats are there?
questions.explanation:
Make a guess-and-check table:
• Guess 1: 10 goats, 12 chickens → Legs = 10×4 + 12×2 = 40 + 24 = 64 (too few)
• Guess 2: 12 goats, 10 chickens → Legs = 12×4 + 10×2 = 48 + 20 = 68 ✓
Answer: 12 goats
